node.title: Her Instagram Handle Was ‘Metaverse.’ Last Month, It Vanished.
node.description: Five days after Facebook changed its name to Meta, an Australian artist found herself blocked, with seemingly no recourse, from an account documenting nearly a decade of her life and work.

node.title: Katherine named 'ground zero' for COVID in the NT on day of record case numbers
node.description: As the NT's current outbreak increases by 16 cases, new CHO directions order anyone who has left the Katherine area since November 29 to get a COVID test within the next three days.

node.title: The Seattle Seahawks’ Boom Is Busted
node.description: The bold energy that defined the Seattle Seahawks is gone. What will replace it?

node.title: Your Monday Briefing
node.description: Deadly storms in the U.S.

node.title: Daylight execution of Sydney lawyer 'amateurish' and 'shambolic', court told
node.description: Two men behind an "inept" plan to recover money from a Sydney solicitor prepare to be sentenced for their crimes almost three years after the 65-year-old's death.

node.title: Tom Brady Sets 2 More Unbelievable Records in OT Win Sunday, Ties Another
node.description: He broke an unthinkable NFL record and extended another incredible record that he already owned.

node.title: How an Australian decided Verstappen and Hamilton's F1 world championship battle
node.description: An Australian played a critical part in one of Formula One's most controversial championship deciding races in history, and he probably wishes he didn't have to.

node.title: 'Very strong chance' COVID has spread into more remote communities as NT records 17 cases overnight
node.description: Seventeen new cases of COVID have recorded in the NT overnight, including 16 linked to the Katherine outbreak, as authorities warn there's a "very strong chance" more remote communities will record cases in coming days.

node.title: Epidemiologist sounds warning ahead of WA border reopening call
node.description: A leading West Australian epidemiologist warns Mark McGowan to reconsider opening the state's border early next year as the Omicron COVID-19 variant continues to spark concern.

node.title: COVID 'spot fires' to spread quickly through Queensland but system will cope, new CHO says
node.description: On his first day as Queensland's Chief Health Officer, John Gerrard tells a media conference that with the border now open to all interstate hotspots, COVID outbreaks are inevitable.

node.title: SA records 13 new COVID-19 cases as government works to fast-track Omicron testing
node.description: South Australia records another 13 cases of COVID-19, with the majority expected to be the Delta variant.

node.title: ‘Insecure’ Recap, Season 5, Episode 8: Fears and Desires
node.description: This week, Issa is thriving personally and professionally, but a series of dreams (or nightmares) inject uncertainty into her situation.

node.title: Shayna Jack emotional after swimming return
node.description: Shayna Jack has comfortably won her 100m freestyle heat at the Queensland Championships, her first individual race since the end of a two-year drugs ban.

node.title: Omicron variant: Border reopening plans may need to be delayed - Covid-19 modeller
node.description: New Zealand may need to delay international border reopening in the face of the 'incredibly fast' spread of the Omicron variant, to give time for more people to have a vaccination booster, a data… Audio

node.title: Police appeal for information on missing Auckland man
node.description: Police have appealed for any information on the whereabouts of 65-year-old Auckland man Atonio Finau, who has been missing for almost a month.

node.title: Health providers unite in final vaccination effort before Auckland re-opens
node.description: The West Auckland Whānau Ora Battalion is joining forces with the South Seas Healthcare, Manukau Urban Māori Authority and the Turuiki Healthcare Vaccination Fleets over the next two days.

node.title: Meadows Was Deeply Involved in Fighting Election Outcome, Jan. 6 Panel Says
node.description: The House committee laid out its case for a contempt of Congress charge against Mark Meadows, the chief of staff to former President Donald J. Trump.

node.title: In Kentucky, Tallying the Grim Scale of Destruction
node.description: “I don’t think we’ll have seen damage at this scale, ever,” said Gov. Andy Beshear of Kentucky in the wake of the devastating tornadoes on Friday.

node.title: ALW wrap: impact imports, an injury dilemma, and a big club's identity crisis
node.description: Which imports made the biggest impact for their club? How will Victory manage their injury domino-effect? And what's the problem with Western Sydney Wanderers? Samantha Lewis reviews round two of the A-League Women's competition.

node.title: 'I just want to be with him': Love conquers all as couples reunite
node.description: Christmas wishes have been granted across Queensland today as couples separated by seas and states reunite again on the Gold and Sunshine coasts.

node.title: Water quality testing for summer swimming spots begins in Otago
node.description: Otago swimmers are urged to check the latest water quality results before taking the plunge this summer.

node.title: Waikato bus drivers to get $1000 Christmas bonus
node.description: Waikato Regional Council has allocated an extra $200,000 to drivers as the region, like others, struggles to get enough of them for its services.

node.title: How to help victims of the tornadoes.
node.description: Here’s how to pitch in as local and national volunteers and aid groups mobilize to help hard-hit areas.

node.title: Father who violently shook baby daughter has 'no explanation, no contrition or remorse'
node.description: A man found guilty of recklessly causing harm to his newborn baby by violently shaking her has been bashed in prison and is withdrawn, depressed and suicidal, an Adelaide court hears.

node.title: Metlifecare completes $1.25b refinancing deal
node.description: The retirement village operator's debt facilities were converted into a sustainability-linked loan tied to social and environmental goals.

node.title: Award-winning album inspired by 'reconnecting with my culture', Tree says
node.description: Double Pacific Music Awards winner 'Tree' says making the winning album Mrs Tree allowed her to reconnect with her Samoan culture. Video, Audio

node.title: Humid, wet weather forecast for much of the country
node.description: Much of New Zealand will need to brace for heavy rain over the coming days with warnings issued for Bay of Plenty, Nelson and Taranaki.

node.title: Coroner recommends tougher safety rules after forestry worker's death
node.description: The father of a forestry worker killed on the job says a coroner's findings could herald a shake-up for the industry.

node.title: Immune cells in prostate can be activated to destroy cancer cells, research shows
node.description: New research shows prostate cancer could be effectively treated with immunotherapy.

node.title: New telescope will allow scientists to look back in time
node.description: Scott Pelley reports on the James Webb Space Telescope, due to launch December 22. Scientists hope it will be able to see the universe's first stars and galaxies.
